body_content.explanation: a wild, climbing plant of the cucumber family with small, greenish flowers, red berries, and a large, thick root:
examples: Bryony has a big root similar to a parsnip.
White bryony is the only member of the cucumber family native to the UK.
White bryony berries are pinkish red, and trail in strings over the hedges.

body_content.explanation: a wild, climbing plant of the yam family with heart-shaped leaves, small, greenish-white flowers, red berries, and a large, thick root:
examples: This bryony is perennial climber with a large, black tuber.
The bright-red berries of black bryony are attractive but poisonous.
